channel.title: Five Eyes on The Encryption Compendium
channel.description: Recent content in Five Eyes on The Encryption Compendium

item.title: 'Five Eyes' Security Alliance Calls for Access to Encrypted Material
item.description: Authors: Hosenball, Mark and Holden, Michael Published: July 2019 URL: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-security-fiveeyes-britain-idUSKCN1UP199 Abstract: The U.S.-led “Five Eyes” intelligence alliance said on Tuesday that te…

item.title: Australian Government Passes Contentious Encryption Law
item.description: Authors: Tarabay, Jamie Published: June 2018 URL: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/06/world/australia/encryption-bill-nauru.html Abstract: The law, opposed by privacy advocates, requires tech companies to provide law enforcement and security agencies with access to encrypted communications.

item.title: Canada’s New and Irresponsible Encryption Policy: How the Government of Canada’s New Policy Threatens Charter Rights, Cybersecurity, Economic Growth, and Foreign Policy
item.description: Authors: Parsons, Christopher Published: August 2019 URL: https://citizenlab.ca/2019/08/canadas-new-and-irresponsible-encryption-policy-how-the-government-of-canadas-new-policy-threatens-charter-rights-cybersecurity-economic-growth-and-foreign-policy/ Abstract: The proposed rationales for weakening encryption would result in significant loses to Canadians’ abilities to exercise their rights and freedoms.

item.title: Coalition Letter to Ministers Responsible for the Five Eyes Security Community
The Five Eyes Statement on Encryption: Things Are Seldom What They Seem
item.description: Authors: Landau, Susan Published: September 2018 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/five-eyes-statement-encryption-things-are-seldom-what-they-seem Abstract: Earlier this September, law enforcement officials from the Five Eyes intelligence alliance—made up of Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, and the United States—met in Australia and issued a Statement of Principles on Access to Evidence and Encryption.

item.title: Travel Guide to the Digital World: Encryption Policy for Human Rights Defenders
“Five Eyes” Governments Respond to Coalition Demands to Stop Undermining Encryption
item.description: Authors: Cyphers, Bennett and Stepanovich, Amie Published: October 2017 URL: https://www.accessnow.org/five-eyes-governments-respond-coalition-demands-stop-undermining-encryption/ Abstract: Status update on the Five Eyes governments’ position on encryption
